body:
[Changes from v0.2.7 to v0.2.8](https://github.com/mesos/storm/compare/v0.2.7...v0.2.8)

* Fix a problem where a worker could be launched by the wrong topology supervisor, leading to the wrongly-owned worker having a different set of resources than requested. See the [release notes](https://github.com/erikdw/storm/releases/tag/v1.0.6-storm-mesos3) for that custom storm version.

[Changes from v0.2.6 to v0.2.7](https://github.com/mesos/storm/compare/v0.2.6...v0.2.7)

* Fix for log rotation bug in log4j2, which is brought in via a new custom storm build that upgrades log4j2 to 2.8.2.  See the [release notes](https://github.com/erikdw/storm/releases/tag/v1.0.6-storm-mesos2) for that custom storm version.

[Changes from v0.2.5 to v0.2.6](https://github.com/mesos/storm/compare/v0.2.5...v0.2.6)

* Support for Storm 1.0.6. This includes:
  * the much better `storm-kafka-client` implementation from Storm 1.2.0 which was backported into Storm 1.0.6
  * ability to configure the pagination of tables in the Storm UI (so we can have "all" as default)
* Use [custom Storm build](https://github.com/erikdw/storm/releases/tag/v1.0.6-storm-mesos1):
  *  shorten Storm daemon classpaths so that `ps` output shows the full commands
  * disables the Rebalance button in the Storm UI (since it doesn't do anything in storm-mesos)
  * disables the rebalance action in the Storm Nimbus implementation, so that attempts to rebalance via API or CLI are also denied

name: v0.2.5
body:
[Changes from v0.2.4 to v0.2.5](https://github.com/mesos/storm/compare/v0.2.4...v0.2.5)

* Support for (optionally) automatically launching logviewer as a "sidecar" Mesos Task (1 logviewer per host per storm-mesos framework).
* Upgrade Storm version from 1.0.3 to 1.0.5.
* Use [custom Storm build](https://github.com/erikdw/storm/releases/tag/v1.0.5-storm-mesos1):
   * shorten Storm daemon classpaths so that `ps` output shows the full commands
   * disables the Rebalance button in the Storm UI (since it doesn't do anything in storm-mesos)
   * add ability to configure the pagination of tables in the Storm UI (so we can have "all" as default)
* Fix problem where Supervisors could linger forever as zombies with no worker tasks (this depended on the custom Storm build)

name: v0.1.10
body:
[Changes from v0.1.9 to v0.1.10](https://github.com/mesos/storm/compare/v0.1.9...v0.1.10)
- Automated launching of logviewer, from PR #228, which is a backport of PR #212 from master.

[Changes from v0.1.8 to v0.1.9](https://github.com/mesos/storm/compare/v0.1.8...v0.1.9)
- Shuffle order in which hosts are accessed to create worker slots. This prevents workers that die from continually having replacement workers assigned to the same host, skewing the workload in a cluster. PR #224 addressed this.

[Changes from v0.1.7 to v0.1.8](https://github.com/mesos/storm/compare/v0.1.7...v0.1.8)
- Add selfless offer handling. i.e., stop aggressively hoarding offers and thus starving other frameworks in a mesos cluster.  PR #200 fixes issue #50.

[Changes from v0.2.3 to v0.2.4](https://github.com/mesos/storm/compare/v0.2.3...v0.2.4)
- Add selfless offer handling. i.e., stop aggressively hoarding offers and thus starving other frameworks in a mesos cluster.  PR #200 fixes issue #50.

name: v0.2.3
body:
[Changes from v0.2.1 to v0.2.3](https://github.com/mesos/storm/compare/v0.2.1...v0.2.3)
- NOTE: v0.2.2 was a broken release, due to a deprecated flag in the `docker` command.
- Update from Storm v1.0.2 to Storm v1.0.3.
- Dropped support for Storm v1.0.2 and below in the master branch of this project.

[Changes from v0.2.0 to v0.2.1](https://github.com/mesos/storm/compare/v0.2.0...v0.2.1)
- Switch from **mesos-1.0.1** to **mesos-1.1.0**.

[Changes from v0.1.7 to v0.2.0](https://github.com/mesos/storm/compare/v0.1.7...v0.2.0)
- Initial release of **storm-1.x** and **mesos-1.x** support.
- Drops builds targeting **mesos-0.27.x**.
- Drops support for **storm-0.x**.  That will continue in the v0.1.x versioned builds which are created from the [storm-0.x branch](https://github.com/mesos/storm/tree/storm-0.x).

name: v0.1.7
body:
[Changes from v0.1.5 to v0.1.7](https://github.com/mesos/storm/compare/v0.1.5...v0.1.7)
- _NOTE_: Since 0.1.6 was not a complete release, we are providing the changes from the last good release of 0.1.5.

Main change in 0.1.7 is: [respect storm.yaml's `nimbus.host` parameter](https://github.com/mesos/storm/commit/ae7695895d8ad3653af16ef2f4e9bea6aab3e7a6).

name: v0.1.6
body: This is an abortive release.  The `bin/build-release.sh` script failed when travis-ci tried to build the releases using the default MIRROR value.  [This has been fixed](https://github.com/mesos/storm/commit/4fbc601d111e467296de5b965d0ed2ca8528ff73) and we created a new release of 0.1.7.

name: v0.1.5
body:
[Changes from v0.1.4 to v0.1.5](https://github.com/mesos/storm/compare/v0.1.4...v0.1.5)

This release includes support for consolidating resource Offers received from Mesos. i.e., if Offers come from the same host we aggregate them together.

**_Benefits:_** This prevents starvation problems we previously witnessed, where the Mesos UI would show a bunch of available resources, but the topologies were failing to get scheduled.

**_Background:_** This is an extension and improvement of the earlier changes made to have this framework implement the IScheduler interface from storm-core, which was already mitigating another starvation issue:  "large" topologies (those that need a lot of resources such as CPU) would starve smaller topologies from getting resources.

name: v0.1.4
body:
[Changes from v0.1.3 to v0.1.4](https://github.com/mesos/storm/compare/v0.1.3...v0.1.4)

Most notably, this release adds a few enhancements to the released packages based on storm-0.9.6:  instead of using the original apache storm-0.9.6 binaries, we now include a patched version of storm-0.9.6 from erikdw/storm:
- https://github.com/erikdw/storm/releases

name: v0.1.3
body:
[Changes from v0.1.2 to v0.1.3](https://github.com/mesos/storm/compare/v0.1.2...v0.1.3)

Unfortunately, some of the builds failed, so we don't have packages nor Docker images for all combinations.  The problems are 2-fold:
- I built this release prematurely, since `mesos-0.28.2` was just released and mesosphere hasn't had time to create their debian packages and upload them yet.  So I'll just wait for that to happen and then release v0.1.4.
- DockerHub responded with an HTTP 500 error after the 1st image was pushed for the `storm-0.9.6`+`mesos-0.27.2` combo, thus stopping that build combo from completing.

So we only have a complete release of v0.1.3 for the `storm-0.10.1`+`mesos-0.27.2` combo.   We should consider adding a sleep and retry mechanism into the "docker push".  So we added retries for the travis steps that depend on remote resources:
- https://github.com/mesos/storm/issues/144
- https://github.com/mesos/storm/pull/145

name: v0.1.0: first "official" release
body: _TODO(erikdw)_: add some details about the release.
